sub_topic: Calculation of Carnot efficiency of a heat engine
message_1: A heat engine is operating between two temperatures of 500 K and 300 K. Calculate the maximum efficiency of the engine using Carnot's cycle.
message_2:
The maximum efficiency of a heat engine operating between two temperatures can be determined using the Carnot efficiency formula:

Efficiency (η) = 1 - (Tc/Th)

where η is the efficiency, Tc is the temperature of the cold reservoir (in Kelvin), and Th is the temperature of the hot reservoir (in Kelvin).

In this case, Tc = 300 K and Th = 500 K. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

Efficiency (η) = 1 - (300 K / 500 K) = 1 - 0.6 = 0.4

So, the maximum efficiency of the heat engine operating between these two temperatures using Carnot's cycle is 40%.
